summary: This is an internal email from June 29, 2020, requesting approval for travel expenses for a team to travel to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation. The team plans to drive, possibly escort the target back to New York, and includes estimated costs for hotel, per diem, and parking.

persons.name: II MINIME
persons.context: Appears to be the individual writing the email to request approval for travel to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned travel to arrest target
events.description: A team plans to travel to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, possibly escorting the target back to New York.

keyFacts: A travel approval request was made on June 29, 2020, for an operation related to the Epstein investigation.
The operation's purpose was to arrest a target believed to be in Massachusetts.
The planned travel involved a team of four individuals, including the requester and two supervisors.
The team planned to drive and possibly escort the arrested target back to New York.
The estimated total cost for the four-person team was $1,060.
